items.title: Violence erupts after Mexican cartel leader "El Mencho" killed in federal operation
items.standfirst: Mexico's Ministry of Defense security forces killed the leader of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel, Nemesio Rubén Oseguera Cervantes, known as "El Mencho," in a military operation.
items.content: Mexico's Ministry of Defense security forces killed the leader of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel, Nemesio Rubén Oseguera Cervantes, known as "El Mencho," in a military operation.

items.title: Portrait of a drug lord: ‘El Mencho’, Mexico's most feared cartel kingpin
items.standfirst: Nemesio Oseguera Cervantes, known as "El Mencho", was the feared architect of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel, one of Mexico’s most powerful criminal organisations. Over decades, he expanded the group’s operations across multiple states and international markets, becoming a central figure in the country’s narcotics trade and the top-ranked drug trafficker on the US most-wanted list.
items.content: Nemesio Oseguera Cervantes, known as "El Mencho", was the feared architect of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel, one of Mexico’s most powerful criminal organisations. Over decades, he expanded the group’s operations across multiple states and international markets, becoming a central figure in the country’s narcotics trade and the top-ranked drug trafficker on the US most-wanted list.

items.title: Wave of violence in Mexico after military kills cartel boss 'El Mencho'
items.standfirst: One of Mexico's most notorious drug lords, Nemesio Oseguera, or "El Mencho," was killed in a military raid on Sunday, sparking widespread retaliatory violence. After reports of El Mencho's death, cartel henchmen blockaded highways with burning cars and torched businesses in more than a half a dozen states, paralyzing parts of the country.
items.content: One of Mexico's most notorious drug lords, Nemesio Oseguera, or "El Mencho," was killed in a military raid on Sunday, sparking widespread retaliatory violence. After reports of El Mencho's death, cartel henchmen blockaded highways with burning cars and torched businesses in more than a half a dozen states, paralyzing parts of the country.

items.title: Mexico fears more violence after army kills leader of powerful Jalisco cartel
items.standfirst: School was canceled in several Mexican states and local and foreign governments alike warned their citizens to stay inside following the army's killing of the leader of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel, Nemesio Rubén Oseguera Cervantes, "El Mencho," and the violence it spurred
items.content: School was canceled in several Mexican states and local and foreign governments alike warned their citizens to stay inside following the army's killing of the leader of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel, Nemesio Rubén Oseguera Cervantes, "El Mencho," and the violence it spurred(Image credit: Armando Solis)

items.title: How Mexico killed the powerful drug kingpin 'El Mencho' and what it means
items.standfirst: Mexico’s security forces on Sunday killed Nemesio Oseguera Cervantes, the nation's most powerful cartel leader, after he was wounded during an attempted arrest in Jalisco state and died while being transferred to Mexico City. His killing marks the highest-profile blow against cartels in a decade and sparked a wave of arson and road blockades across large parts of the country.
items.content: Mexico’s security forces on Sunday killed Nemesio Oseguera Cervantes, the nation's most powerful cartel leader, after he was wounded during an attempted arrest in Jalisco state and died while being transferred to Mexico City. His killing marks the highest-profile blow against cartels in a decade and sparked a wave of arson and road blockades across large parts of the country.

items.title: Who was El Mencho, the former police officer who co-founded an ultraviolent cartel in Mexico?
items.standfirst: Drug lord who was killed by Mexican special forces on Sunday led a cartel known for aggression and military-style arsenalViolence erupts after Mexican security forces kill drug cartel boss ‘El Mencho’ The drug lord “El Mencho”, who was killed on Sunday by Mexican special forces, was the co-founder and leader of a gang that in recent years had become the country’s most powerful criminal organisation: the Jalisco New Generation Cartel (CJNG).While less internationally famous than the Sinaloa cartel of the now imprisoned Joaquín “El Chapo” Guzmán, the CJNG is a household name in Mexico, where it is known for its displays of ultraviolence and its big, military-style arsenal. Continue reading...
items.content: Drug lord who was killed by Mexican special forces on Sunday led a cartel known for aggression and military-style arsenalViolence erupts after Mexican security forces kill drug cartel boss ‘El Mencho’ The drug lord “El Mencho”, who was killed on Sunday by Mexican special forces, was the co-founder and leader of a gang that in recent years had become the country’s most powerful criminal organisation: the Jalisco New Generation Cartel (CJNG).While less internationally famous than the Sinaloa cartel of the now imprisoned Joaquín “El Chapo” Guzmán, the CJNG is a household name in Mexico, where it is known for its displays of ultraviolence and its big, military-style arsenal. Continue reading...

items.title: The violent history of "El Mencho," the cartel leader killed in Mexico
items.standfirst: Nemesio Rubén Oseguera Cervantes — also known as "El Mencho" — was the leader of the notorious Jalisco New Generation Cartel prior to his death on Sunday.

items.title: Violence in Mexico after cartel leader "El Mencho" killed in military operation
items.standfirst: Mexican security forces killed Nemesio Rubén Oseguera Cervantes, also known as "El Mencho," during an operation in the western state of Jalisco, Mexico's Ministry of Defense said Sunday. Violent clashes erupted in parts of western Mexico amid the operation. Americans caught in the chaos have been told to shelter in place. Willie James Inman reports.
items.content: Mexican security forces killed Nemesio Rubén Oseguera Cervantes, also known as "El Mencho," during an operation in the western state of Jalisco, Mexico's Ministry of Defense said Sunday. Violent clashes erupted in parts of western Mexico amid the operation. Americans caught in the chaos have been told to shelter in place. Willie James Inman reports.

items.title: Unrest in Mexico following death of cartel boss ‘El Mencho’
items.standfirst: There was unrest across several Mexican states following the Mexican army's killing of Nemesio Rubén Oseguera Cervantes, "El Mencho." In response, the U.S. issued a safety warning to Americans in parts of Mexico amid ongoing security operations.
items.content: There was unrest across several Mexican states following the Mexican army's killing of Nemesio Rubén Oseguera Cervantes, "El Mencho." In response, the U.S. issued a safety warning to Americans in parts of Mexico amid ongoing security operations.

items.title: Violence erupts after Mexican security forces kill drug cartel boss ‘El Mencho’
items.standfirst: Death of Nemesio Oseguera Cervantes, one of world’s most wanted drug traffickers, sets off wave of disorder across several Mexican statesWho was El Mencho, the former police officer who co-founded an ultraviolent cartel in Mexico?One of the world’s most wanted drug traffickers, the Mexican cartel boss known as “El Mencho”, has been killed by security forces, Mexico’s defence ministry has confirmed. The operation set off a wave of violence, with torched cars and gunmen blocking highways in more than half a dozen states.The drug lord, whose real name is Nemesio Rubén Oseguera Cervantes, was killed on Sunday in the western state of Jalisco along with at least six alleged accomplices, the ministry said in a statement. Continue reading...

The operation set off a wave of violence, with torched cars and gunmen blocking highways in more than half a dozen states.The drug lord, whose real name is Nemesio Rubén Oseguera Cervantes, was killed on Sunday in the western state of Jalisco along with at least six alleged accomplices, the ministry said in a statement. Continue reading...

items.title: Mexican army kills drug lord 'El Mencho' during operation to capture him
items.standfirst: The Mexican army on Sunday announced they had killed drug lord Nemesio Rubén Oseguera Cervantes – leader of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel, which is responsible for trafficking huge quantities of fentanyl and other drugs to the United States. Cervantes, who was better known as “El Mencho”, was wounded in an operation to capture him and died while being flown to Mexico City.
items.content: The Mexican army on Sunday announced they had killed drug lord Nemesio Rubén Oseguera Cervantes – leader of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel, which is responsible for trafficking huge quantities of fentanyl and other drugs to the United States. Cervantes, who was better known as “El Mencho”, was wounded in an operation to capture him and died while being flown to Mexico City.

clusters.title: Netflix boss says $83bn Warner Bros takeover will benefit industry
clusters.neutral_headline: Netflix boss says $83bn Warner Bros takeover will benefit industry
bullet_summary: Reported by Guardian World, BBC Top Stories, Guardian Business

items.title: Netflix boss says $83bn Warner Bros takeover will benefit industry
items.standfirst: Comments by Ted Sarandos follow Donald Trump’s demand for company to remove Democrat from boardTrump warns Netflix of ‘consequences’ unless it pulls top Democrat from boardBusiness live – latest updatesThe boss of Netflix has launched a fresh defence of its $82.7bn (£61bn) takeover of Warner Bros Discovery (WBD) assets, as he defended the streaming company’s contribution to the UK film and TV industry.Ted Sarandos claimed Netflix buying WBD would bring “growth” to the entertainment industry, amid attempts by rival Paramount Skydance to launch a counter offer for the studio business which he said would do the opposite. Continue reading...
items.content: Comments by Ted Sarandos follow Donald Trump’s demand for company to remove Democrat from boardTrump warns Netflix of ‘consequences’ unless it pulls top Democrat from boardBusiness live – latest updatesThe boss of Netflix has launched a fresh defence of its $82.7bn (£61bn) takeover of Warner Bros Discovery (WBD) assets, as he defended the streaming company’s contribution to the UK film and TV industry.Ted Sarandos claimed Netflix buying WBD would bring “growth” to the entertainment industry, amid attempts by rival Paramount Skydance to launch a counter offer for the studio business which he said would do the opposite. Continue reading...

items.title: Netflix boss defends bid for Warner Bros as Paramount deadline looms
items.standfirst: Ted Sarandos says his company's offer is better for industry growth as it is "buying assets we don't currently have".
items.content: Ted Sarandos says his company's offer is better for industry growth as it is "buying assets we don't currently have".

items.title: Trump warns Netflix of ‘consequences’ unless it pulls top Democrat from board
items.standfirst: US president calls for removal of Susan Rice as streaming platform pursues takeover of Warner Bros DiscoveryDonald Trump has told Netflix to remove the Democratic foreign policy expert Susan Rice from its board or “face the consequences”, while the streaming platform is locked in an extraordinary corporate battle to take control of Warner Bros Discovery (WBD).In comments posted on his Truth Social platform, the US president described Rice – who served as national security adviser to Barack Obama and UN ambassador and White House adviser under Joe Biden – as a “political hack” and accused her of having “no talent or skills”. Continue reading...
items.content: US president calls for removal of Susan Rice as streaming platform pursues takeover of Warner Bros DiscoveryDonald Trump has told Netflix to remove the Democratic foreign policy expert Susan Rice from its board or “face the consequences”, while the streaming platform is locked in an extraordinary corporate battle to take control of Warner Bros Discovery (WBD).In comments posted on his Truth Social platform, the US president described Rice – who served as national security adviser to Barack Obama and UN ambassador and White House adviser under Joe Biden – as a “political hack” and accused her of having “no talent or skills”. Continue reading...

clusters.title: US to stop collecting Trump tariffs ruled illegal by supreme court
clusters.neutral_headline: US to stop collecting Trump tariffs ruled illegal by supreme court
bullet_summary: Reported by Guardian World, France24, Guardian Business

items.title: US to stop collecting Trump tariffs ruled illegal by supreme court
items.standfirst: Dollar slumps and gold rises as authorities say they will halt levies linked to emergency powers but give no word on refundsBusiness live – latest updatesDonald Trump’s administration has said it will stop collecting tariffs the supreme court ruled were illegal as they were imposed using emergency powers, as investors attempted to digest the US president’s latest volley of replacement levies.The US dollar slumped 0.4% against a basket of other currencies on Monday after the US Customs and Border Protection (CBP) agency said it would deactivate all tariff codes associated with International Emergency Economic Powers Act (IEEPA) related orders as of Tuesday at midnight (5am UK time). Continue reading...
items.content: Dollar slumps and gold rises as authorities say they will halt levies linked to emergency powers but give no word on refundsBusiness live – latest updatesDonald Trump’s administration has said it will stop collecting tariffs the supreme court ruled were illegal as they were imposed using emergency powers, as investors attempted to digest the US president’s latest volley of replacement levies.The US dollar slumped 0.4% against a basket of other currencies on Monday after the US Customs and Border Protection (CBP) agency said it would deactivate all tariff codes associated with International Emergency Economic Powers Act (IEEPA) related orders as of Tuesday at midnight (5am UK time). Continue reading...

items.title: China calls on US to cancel Trump-era tariffs following Supreme Court ruling
items.standfirst: China on Monday urged the United States to cancel unilateral tariffs announced by President Donald Trump after the US Supreme Court struck down many of his measures, ruling he lacked authority under a 1977 law. Trump responded by unveiling new global import duties of up to 15% under different powers.
items.content: China on Monday urged the United States to cancel unilateral tariffs announced by President Donald Trump after the US Supreme Court struck down many of his measures, ruling he lacked authority under a 1977 law. Trump responded by unveiling new global import duties of up to 15% under different powers.

items.title: Trump raises tariffs to 15% on imports from all countries
items.standfirst: President announced increase from 10% using different authority from mechanism that supreme court struck down on FridayDonald Trump announced on Saturday that he would raise a temporary tariff rate on US imports from all countries from 10% to 15%, less than 24 hours after the US supreme court ruled against the legality of his flagship trade policy.Infuriated by the high court’s ruling on Friday that he had exceeded his authority and should have got congressional approval for the tariffs he introduced last year under the International Emergency Economic Powers Act (IEEPA), the US president railed against the justices who struck down his use of tariffs – calling them a “disgrace to the nation” – and ordered an immediate 10% tariff on all imports, in addition to any existing levies, under a separate law. Continue reading...
items.content: President announced increase from 10% using different authority from mechanism that supreme court struck down on FridayDonald Trump announced on Saturday that he would raise a temporary tariff rate on US imports from all countries from 10% to 15%, less than 24 hours after the US supreme court ruled against the legality of his flagship trade policy.Infuriated by the high court’s ruling on Friday that he had exceeded his authority and should have got congressional approval for the tariffs he introduced last year under the International Emergency Economic Powers Act (IEEPA), the US president railed against the justices who struck down his use of tariffs – calling them a “disgrace to the nation” – and ordered an immediate 10% tariff on all imports, in addition to any existing levies, under a separate law. Continue reading...

bullet_summary: Reported by Al Jazeera, Guardian World, France24

items.title: New York Mayor Zohran Mamdani orders citywide shutdown as snowstorm hits
items.standfirst: The city's entire traffic network is shut down except for emergency travel as a severe snowstorm hits northeast US.
items.content: The city's entire traffic network is shut down except for emergency travel as a severe snowstorm hits northeast US.

items.title: Zohran Mamdani orders travel ban in New York as US north-east braces for heavy snow amid blizzard warnings
items.standfirst: East coast scrambles to prepare for storm forecast to bring major disruption to more than 35 million peopleNew York mayor Zohran Mamdani has ordered a citywide travel ban for all but emergency travel, as the north-eastern United States was preparing for an intense winter storm that is forecast to reach blizzard strength and bring major disruption.Residents along the east coast scrambled to prepare for the late-winter storm that spurred weather warnings from Maryland to Massachusetts, affecting more than 35 million people. More than a foot of snow was expected, with wind gusts of up to 70mph and warnings of potential coastal flooding from Cape Cod to Delaware. Continue reading...
items.content: East coast scrambles to prepare for storm forecast to bring major disruption to more than 35 million peopleNew York mayor Zohran Mamdani has ordered a citywide travel ban for all but emergency travel, as the north-eastern United States was preparing for an intense winter storm that is forecast to reach blizzard strength and bring major disruption.Residents along the east coast scrambled to prepare for the late-winter storm that spurred weather warnings from Maryland to Massachusetts, affecting more than 35 million people. More than a foot of snow was expected, with wind gusts of up to 70mph and warnings of potential coastal flooding from Cape Cod to Delaware. Continue reading...

items.title: New York mayor Mamdani orders citywide travel ban ahead of major snowstorm
items.standfirst: New York Mayor Zohran Mamdani on Sunday ordered a travel ban and shutdown of the city's traffic network ahead of a massive snowstorm expected to hit the northeast United States. The ban will not affect essential workers or New Yorkers needing to travel due to emergencies.
items.content: New York Mayor Zohran Mamdani on Sunday ordered a travel ban and shutdown of the city's traffic network ahead of a massive snowstorm expected to hit the northeast United States. The ban will not affect essential workers or New Yorkers needing to travel due to emergencies.

items.title: One Battle After Another triumphs at UK’s BAFTA film awards
items.standfirst: The offbeat thriller has won six BAFTAs, including best film and best director for Paul Thomas Anderson.
items.content: The offbeat thriller has won six BAFTAs, including best film and best director for Paul Thomas Anderson.

items.title: Watch: How the winners accepted their awards
items.standfirst: One Battle After Another took home best film and Hamnet also saw success in the outstanding British film category.
items.content: One Battle After Another took home best film and Hamnet also saw success in the outstanding British film category.

items.title: The winners list in full
items.standfirst: One Battle After Another won six awards, followed by I Swear, Sinners and Frankenstein, with three each.
items.content: One Battle After Another won six awards, followed by I Swear, Sinners and Frankenstein, with three each.

items.title: In pictures: Stars on the red carpet
items.standfirst: Stars of Sinners, Hamnet and One Battle After Another were among big names attending the ceremony.
items.content: Stars of Sinners, Hamnet and One Battle After Another were among big names attending the ceremony.

items.title: 'One Battle After Another' wins six BAFTA awards including best picture and director
items.standfirst: Director Paul Thomas Anderson's politically charged thriller “One Battle After Another” took six prizes, including best picture and best director, at the British Academy Film Awards on Sunday. Blues-steeped vampire epic “Sinners” and gothic horror story “Frankenstein” won three awards each, while Shakespearean family tragedy “Hamnet” was named best British film.
items.content: Director Paul Thomas Anderson's politically charged thriller “One Battle After Another” took six prizes, including best picture and best director, at the British Academy Film Awards on Sunday. Blues-steeped vampire epic “Sinners” and gothic horror story “Frankenstein” won three awards each, while Shakespearean family tragedy “Hamnet” was named best British film.

bullet_summary: Former senior civil servants said they were shocked to see the claims, and that there was a culture of deference towards the former prince within Whitehall that allowed them to proceed
Reported by Guardian World, BBC Top Stories

items.title: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor charged massages to taxpayers while trade envoy, say reports
items.standfirst: Former senior civil servants say culture of deference meant excessive expenses claims were waved throughAndrew Mountbatten-Windsor charged taxpayers for the cost of massages and excessive travel expenses while he was the UK’s trade envoy, it has been reported.Former senior civil servants said they were shocked to see the claims, and that there was a culture of deference towards the former prince within Whitehall that allowed them to proceed. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Racial slur shouted at 'Sinners' actors during BAFTAs
clusters.neutral_headline: Racial slur shouted at 'Sinners' actors during BAFTAs
bullet_summary: Reported by NBC World, Reuters Top News

items.title: Racial slur shouted at 'Sinners' actors during BAFTAs
items.standfirst: The BBC apologized for the “strong and offensive language” that was shouted during the taping of the British Academy Film Awards after a clip of an attendee yelling a racial slur at Michael B. Jordan and Delroy Lindo sparked outrage online. A spokesperson for the BBC attributed the language outbursts to an attendee with Tourette syndrome.
items.content: The BBC apologized for the “strong and offensive language” that was shouted during the taping of the British Academy Film Awards after a clip of an attendee yelling a racial slur at Michael B. Jordan and Delroy Lindo sparked outrage online. A spokesperson for the BBC attributed the language outbursts to an attendee with Tourette syndrome.

items.title: Why did a man shout a racial slur at the BAFTAs? #tabloid
items.standfirst: What happened during the BAFTA ceremony During the British Academy Film Awards a campaigner with Tourette syndrome unexpectedly shouted a racial slur while actors were presenting onstage. The outburst occurred as Michael B. Jordan and Delroy Lindo were introducing an award, and it was audible…
items.content: What happened during the BAFTA ceremony During the British Academy Film Awards a campaigner with Tourette syndrome unexpectedly shouted a racial slur while actors were presenting onstage. The outburst occurred as Michael B. Jordan and Delroy Lindo were introducing an award, and it was audible…

items.title: Why did John Davidson shout at the BAFTAs? #tabloid
items.standfirst: What happened during the BAFTAs ceremony During the 2026 BAFTA Film Awards, Tourette’s syndrome campaigner John Davidson let out an involuntary outburst that included a racial slur while actors Michael B. Jordan and Delroy Lindo were presenting an award. The moment interrupted the live ceremony…
items.content: What happened during the BAFTAs ceremony During the 2026 BAFTA Film Awards, Tourette’s syndrome campaigner John Davidson let out an involuntary outburst that included a racial slur while actors Michael B. Jordan and Delroy Lindo were presenting an award. The moment interrupted the live ceremony…

items.standfirst: A tense, confusing moment at a major awards ceremony A loud, racial slur was heard in the audience during a BAFTA Film Awards presentation, and the incident quickly dominated the evening’s coverage. The person identified as the source is a campaigner who has been public about living with Tourette…

clusters.title: France to summon U.S. ambassador over comments on activist's death
clusters.neutral_headline: France to summon U.S. ambassador over comments on activist's death
bullet_summary: Reported by CBS News, France24

items.title: France to summon U.S. ambassador over comments on activist's death
items.standfirst: The U.S. State Department's Counterterrorism Bureau shared a post on X about Quentin Deranque, a far-right activist, who died of brain injuries after being beaten.
items.content: The U.S. State Department's Counterterrorism Bureau shared a post on X about Quentin Deranque, a far-right activist, who died of brain injuries after being beaten.

items.title: France to summon US ambassador over Trump admin's comments on far-right activist's killing
items.standfirst: The French foreign ministry will summon the US ambassador to Paris over comments made by the Trump administration about the killing of a French far-right activist blamed on the hard left, France's top diplomat said Sunday. The death of Quentin Deranque has put France on edge, igniting tensions between the left and right ahead of a 2027 presidential vote. FRANCE 24's Douglas Herbert brings you this analysis.
items.content: The French foreign ministry will summon the US ambassador to Paris over comments made by the Trump administration about the killing of a French far-right activist blamed on the hard left, France's top diplomat said Sunday. The death of Quentin Deranque has put France on edge, igniting tensions between the left and right ahead of a 2027 presidential vote. FRANCE 24's Douglas Herbert brings you this analysis.

The game was decided in sudden death when a national‑team forward produced the winning play in overtime, slipping the puck past Canada’s netminder to break a 1 1…

items.title: U.S. beats Canada in thrilling hockey finals to win Olympic gold
items.standfirst: Through a sudden death overtime goal, the U.S. men's hockey team is golden over Canada.
items.content: Through a sudden death overtime goal, the U.S. men's hockey team is golden over Canada.

items.title: Team USA wins first men's hockey Olympic gold medal since 1980 in OT thriller
items.standfirst: The U.S. men's hockey team beat Canada on Sunday to win its first Olympic gold medal since the "Miracle on Ice" in 1980. Kelly O'Grady reports.
items.content: The U.S. men's hockey team beat Canada on Sunday to win its first Olympic gold medal since the "Miracle on Ice" in 1980. Kelly O'Grady reports.

clusters.title: Winter Olympics closing ceremony celebrates athletes and Italian art in Verona
clusters.neutral_headline: Winter Olympics closing ceremony celebrates athletes and Italian art in Verona
bullet_summary: Reported by CBS News, France24

items.title: Winter Olympics closing ceremony celebrates athletes and Italian art in Verona
items.standfirst: The Milan Cortina Olympics ended Sunday with a closing ceremony inside the ancient Roman amphitheater, Verona Arena.
items.content: The Milan Cortina Olympics ended Sunday with a closing ceremony inside the ancient Roman amphitheater, Verona Arena.

items.title: Milano Cortina Winter Olympics come to an end
items.standfirst: The Milano Cortina Winter Olympics came to a spectacular close Sunday night in a historic Roman amphitheater in Verona, Italy. Seth Doane in Cortina covered all 19 days of competition and reflects on its impact.
items.content: The Milano Cortina Winter Olympics came to a spectacular close Sunday night in a historic Roman amphitheater in Verona, Italy. Seth Doane in Cortina covered all 19 days of competition and reflects on its impact.

items.title: Milan-Cortina hands over flag to French Alps for 2030 Winter Olympics
items.standfirst: The Milan Cortina Olympics ended Sunday and passed the Olympic flag over to the next Winter Games host nation, France, raising its flag next to Italy's and Greece's. The closing ceremony payed tribute to Italian dance and music, as some 1,500 Olympians filed into the arena waving small national flags to a medley of Italian pop hits.
items.content: The Milan Cortina Olympics ended Sunday and passed the Olympic flag over to the next Winter Games host nation, France, raising its flag next to Italy's and Greece's. The closing ceremony payed tribute to Italian dance and music, as some 1,500 Olympians filed into the arena waving small national flags to a medley of Italian pop hits.
